TextBody:
Hello Christian,

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Support support.

We always recommend that the Endpoint Protector Client also be upgraded with the Endpoint Protector Server, as the clients are developed and released together under the EPP Server functional releases / versions.
However in this case as SLED version 15 is old we may not have the most recent EPP client, can you let me know what the current EPP client version is that is installed on the SLED endpoint machines please?



Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

TextBody:
Hi Divya,

Yes correct, it should not break anything.  If you do experience any issues then please let us know so that we can take the necessary steps.

IMPORTANT:
Please perform a snapshot (Backup) in the virtualization platform of the current state of your Endpoint Protector appliance prior to applying any upgrades.  This way you will have a safety measure and a quick way to revert back to the previous state in case anything goes wrong during the process.


Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer

Subject: [!]Need Clarification regrd server upgrade [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NoVPx:ref ]

Hello Christian,

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Support support.

We always recommend that the Endpoint Protector Client also be upgraded with the Endpoint Protector Server, as the clients are developed and released together under the EPP Server functional releases / versions.
However in this case as SLED version 15 is old we may not have the most recent EPP client, can you let me know what the current EPP client version is that is installed on the SLED endpoint machines please?



Kind regards
__________________
